title: Engineering Manager, Access Control Engineering
description:
At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment, bringing moments of joy to 200+ million customers. The Access Control Engineering team at Netflix is a central security team that supports the Netflix workforce and partners by creating and operating Access Management & Authorization services for users & applications. Our Enterprise IAM use cases continue to become more complex as we increase investment in Netflix Original content production ecosystems, including Gaming and beyond. Our workforce and partners are global, and they access our resources with different patterns from a variety of locations and devices. Balancing security and ease of access supporting fast-paced timelines, we realize that the traditional corporate network security perimeter no longer meets our requirements. Instead, we invest in Identity as a perimeter in the open internet, with reliable, strong and risk-aware authorization to protect our resources.

Among others, this means we:
Improve and maintain critical workflows such as initial user, service & application access
Develop self-service access management applications and automated elimination of unused user access permissions
Design and build lightweight integrations between services in our environment (both built in-house and SaaS) that need to exchange data

You will collaborate with your team to set the vision for Access Control Engineering within SSE and work with other leaders within Security Engineering to help guide us as an organization. You will likely spend your time networking both inside and outside the company, recruiting for your team, building effective and strong partnerships with stakeholders. You will work closely with partner teams including Platform Engineering, Content Engineering, Application & Infrastructure Security and more, providing and receiving feedback effectively and aligning on shared deliverables as needed.Â Â
